title: Mission & Values
content:
Responsible and ethical business is our way of conducting business. We contribute to climate change and environmental preservation. Our endeavor is to create positive changes to business and society as a whole, with guidance from our values and principles. Commitment to responsible business practices is invariably prioritized. We are building motivated teams by considering our promises to collaboration, diversification, and inclusion. Our team has developed a successful step-by-step process. We incorporate people with exceptional talents, abilities, and potential into an environment which enhances personal growth to apex levels. Our success in attracting and retaining high quality and diverse talent, is a reflection of our outreach to the global societies in which we all live and work.
Founded in 2012, Occams Advisory has fulfilled an unmet need ‚Äì the need for small businesses to have access to an affordable, one-stop shop for strategic advisory and functional services. Through the founder‚Äôs own entrepreneurial experiences, as well as from client feedback, Occams Advisory was created, from day one, to serve the small business market by addressing the most pressing needs of entrepreneurs.
Our name is inspired by the principle of Occams Razor, propounded by William of Occam (1288-1348 AD), an English Franciscan friar and scholastic philosopher. Occams Razor is a line of reasoning that says the simplest answer is often correct. Occams Advisory uses this spirit of problem-solving to provide simple solutions to complex problems, focusing on tangible results, measurable impact and continuous improvement.

title: Let's Partner
content: (Button)

title: Our Philosophies
content:
‚ÄúThrough our observations and learnings, we have created a logical and sequential O.C.C.A.M.S set of Values and Principles, across Emotional, Intellectual and Physical dimensions that human beings operate in. Our beliefs are grounded in latest and most advanced scientific research that explore the effects that emotions have on our entire being originating from cells in particular, on our chromosomes and mitochondrial DNA. Leading scientists and neurologists have aligned to conclude that our emotions can shape our physical reality at the molecular level. Hence, we at Occams emphasize upon Emotions: Feelings as the single most critical building block of Intellect: Thinking which drives and executes our Physical: Being.
Click on the Trinity of O.C.C.A.M.S. philosophies that lay out our model of an ideal individual, intellectual and professional.‚Äù

title: Ownership
content:
Read More
Ownership Emotionality means taking Accountability for the success of the Outcome of our Actions. A culture of Ownership & Accountability, where team members are empowered to make decisions & take Ownership of the Outcomes is a characteristic of our Culture.

title: Clarity
content:
Read More
Emotional Clarity is an Outcome of Self-Awareness. This is a surprisingly rare skill but at Occams we need Employees to use Models such as Antecedent-Behavior-Consequence (ABC) which is an approach that can be used to help examine behaviors that lead to a certain kind of Emotion. To empower ourselves with well-defined goal, we need emotional Clarity. Else internal contradictions derail our progress.

title: Connection
content:
Read More
Connection means feeling in touch with someone who cares about us. Each of us has an innate need to feel safely attached to another person who will be there in our times of physical or emotional need. As a organization driven to achieve high levels of professional excellence, we need to foster the feeling of Connection with our colleagues, clients and community.

title: Appreciation
content:
Read More
Appreciation is a feeling or expression of admiration, approval, or gratitude. Gratitude or gratefulness is a deliberate practice that allows us to appreciate what we are blessed to have. This practice makes us admire what is good in our lives, in people around us and in ourselves. As a result, we start approving and accepting what people are doing and it allows us to filter out instinctively negative reactions and thoughts. This emotional state motivates us to align with win-win outcomes for all the parties involved and avoid prioritizing self-interest which is not sustainable.

title: Manage
content:
Read More
Manage is to be in charge of our emotions and not let our emotions be in charge of us. Though sounding relatively simple, this is a practice that transforms our lives. Faced with the same situation we can choose to have an emotional reaction or a feeling that is for our better. As widely quoted, ‚ÄòBetween stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response. In our response lies our growth and our freedom.‚Äô As we learn and get better at managing our emotions, we will see the direct impact that our emotions have on our mindset and our actions.

title: Serve
content:
Read More
To Serve is probably the most important reason for our existence. The emotion to Serve is to embrace the mindset to serve our purpose, to serve our clients, our communities and our families. A truly effective and inspiring leader is not seeking to lead people; s/he is inspired to serve them. A service mindset is an outlook that focuses on creating customer value, loyalty and trust.

title: Outcome
content:
Read More
Outcome Mindset is a focus on what Output & Impact our Actions (or lack of Actions) are creating on our Employees, Team, Clients & Community that you Service. Outcome Mindset consistently needs you to think of our Actions in terms of the Observable Output that you are creating.

title: Curiosity
content:
Read More
Intellectual Curiosity envelopes the idea of stretching our minds past obvious facts to absorb and understand Context of what you do and the Impact it creates. Curiosity is the drive to understand more about our work and the larger Context of its meaning to our Clients & Team. Curiosity provides the motivation to invest time and energy into pursuit of knowledge.

title: Commitment
content:
Read More
Commitment is ‚Äòthe state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etc.‚Äô. The challenge most professionals encounter is making promises about behaviors and outcomes, but paying insufficient attention to the process necessary to achieve those goals.

title: Anticipation
content:
Read More
Anticipation is the act of looking forward which can be interpreted as visualization of a future event or state. It is a scientifically researched and established dictum that visualization impacts what happens to us. Whether we are convinced or yet to be, the act of being deliberate about what our next hour, day, week, month or year should look like can only empower us with clarity re our own expectations. This clarity results in goals and objectives which in turn set us up for progress in the desired direction.

title: Measure
content:
Read More
Measure is to ascertain the quantum or significance. When choosing where we spend our time, we must first ask the most fundamental question ‚Äì ‚Äòis this important?‚Äô. Any activity that fails this test must be declined. If important, an activity could be either urgent or not urgent. While important & urgent always presses upon us, our greatest success will result from focusing on activities that are Important but not urgent. Activities such as physical exercising, relationship building, academic pursuits and visualizing our perfect future all belong to this category.

title: Seek
content:
Read More
To Seek is to attempt or desire to obtain or achieve. It also has the philosophical meaning to discover the nature of truth and knowledge and to find what is of basic value and importance in life. We must be driven to seek and not to crave to be sought. Seeking makes us look for opportunities and act to achieve. It is fundamental to moving forward and making progress.

title: Ownership
content:
Read More
Output is the Physical Manifestation i.e. Quantifiable result of the Actions taken. At Occams, we are encouraged and even required to have an Output Focus. Unlike cultures where Employees feel content to provide their Inputs, at Occams, we are needed to hyper-focus on Output.

title: Context
content:
Read More
Context is the necessary backdrop to everything that transpires or does not. Nothing exists in pure vacuum. One can identify & observe the Context of any Action. Without being curious about the Context, one might act with inadequate focus on Outcome which will make one less Effective than one could be. Solutions crafted with Context in mind tend to be more effective and serve long-term goals.

title: Communication
content:
Read More
Communication includes speaking, listening, reading, writing and a plethora of non-verbal cues such as body language and tone. At Occams, we believe in top-tier Communication by practicing Proactive Transparency, Explicit Expectations. In each iteration, we ask you to be SMART ‚Äì Specific (in our ask), Measured (in our approach), Articulate (in our expression).

title: Action
content:
Read More
Action is the physical outcome of the philosophy to Act and Not be Acted Upon. We must take an action to progress towards our goals and vision of the future. Each thoughtful and well-directed action moves us along the desired trajectory. The difference between acting versus waiting to be asked or to acted upon is that of day and night. Our core philosophy has to include a habit to be action oriented. While this can lead to mistakes and errors, opportunities for correction and further attempts are provided as a result.

title: Metrics
content:
Read More
Metrics are the method of measuring something, or the results obtained. Results are the objectives and indisputable measure of the outcome from our efforts. Fundamental to our ability to succeed is the commitment to the fact that our Results are the truest measure of how well directed and well executed our efforts are. Thus, beginning by defining the preferred Results in various walks of our lives and directing our focus on getting there is an effective way to make progress. Metrics that measure our progress in the direction of preferred Results keep us honest re the efficacy of our efforts.

title: Simplify
content:
Read More
To Simplify is to reduce to basic essentials, to demystify, to make things less complex. Breaking things down to the core factors and steps facilitates the option to itemize and prioritize. Unless we simplify, we run the risk of being lost in complexities. Simplifying also lets us eliminate what is unnecessary and redundant in the complexity. Simplification lets us focus on the precious few and ignore the distractions in a situation.

title: Our Impact
content: In a world where over a billion people suffer from malnutrition, and even more lack access to clean water, the challenges are immense. About one child in every five receives no education and is at risk. With the world's population set to grow by at least two billion over the next three decades, primarily in the developing world, these challenges can compound. At Occams Advisory, we take the right action by partnering with organizations like blossomprojects.org to implement preventative and remedial steps, working toward a brighter future for all.

title: Know More
content: At Occams Advisory, we believe in the importance of cultural diversity and fostering global connections. It's our pleasure to share that we are a silver-level sponsor of the World Culture Festival, taken place at the National Mall in Washington, D.C., on the September 29 to October 1st, 2023. This three-day celebration showcased incredible talent from around the world and left a lasting impact on how we perceived and connected with one another. We're proud to be a part of this unique event, which embodies our commitment to cultural diversity and community engagement.

title: 62. How is the amount of qualified health plan expenses that is treated as qualified wages determined?
content:
Generally, the qualified health plan expense is the amount that is allocable to the hours for which the employees receive other qualified wages. See:
May an Eligible Employer that averaged 100 or fewer full-time employees in 2019 treat its health plan expenses as ‚Äúqualified wages‚Äù for purposes of the Employee Retention Credit?
May an Eligible Employer that averaged more than 100 employees in 2019 treat its health plan expenses as qualified wages if it continues the employees‚Äô health care coverage, but does not pay the employees‚Äô wages for the time for which the employees are not providing services?
May an Eligible Employer that averaged more than 100 full-time employees in 2019 treat its health plan expenses as qualified wages if it continues the employees‚Äô health care coverage and pays its employees a reduced amount of wages for the time the employees are not providing services?
Qualified health plan expenses are properly treated as qualified wages if the allocation is made on a pro rata basis among covered employees (for example, the average premium for all employees covered by a policy) and pro rata on the basis of periods of coverage (relative to the time periods for which such wages relate).

title: 63. Does the amount of qualified health plan expenses include both the portion of the cost paid by the Eligible Employer and the portion of the cost paid by the employee?
content: The amount of qualified health plan expenses taken into account in determining the amount of qualified wages generally includes both the portion of the cost paid by the Eligible Employer and the portion of the cost paid by the employee with pre-tax salary reduction contributions. However, the qualified health plan expenses should not include amounts that the employee paid for with after-tax contributions.

title: 64. May an Eligible Employer that averaged 100 or fewer full-time employees in 2019 treat its health plan expenses as qualified wages for purposes of the Employee Retention Credit? (updated May 7, 2020)
content:
Yes. An Eligible Employer that averaged 100 or fewer full-time employees in 2019 may treat its health plan expenses paid or incurred, after March 12, 2020, and before January 1, 2021, during any period in a calendar quarter in which the employer‚Äôs business operations are fully or partially suspended due to a governmental order or a calendar quarter in which the employer experiences a significant decline in gross receipts as qualified wages, subject to the maximum of $10,000 per employee for all calendar quarters for all qualified wages. Eligible Employers may treat health plan expenses allocable to the applicable periods as qualified wages even if the employees are not working and the Eligible Employer does not pay the employees any wages for the time they are not working.
Example 1: Employer Y averaged 100 or fewer employees in 2019. Employer Y is subject to a governmental order that partially suspends the operation of its trade or business. In response to the governmental order, Employer Y reduces all employees‚Äô hours by 50 percent. It pays wages to the employees only for the time the employees are providing services, but Employer Y continues to provide the employees with full health care coverage. Employer Y‚Äôs health plan expenses allocable to wages paid during the period its operations were partially suspended may be treated as qualified wages for purposes of the Employee Retention Credit.
Example 2: Employer Z averaged 100 or fewer employees in 2019. Employer Z is subject to a governmental order that suspends the operation of its trade or business. In response to the governmental order, Employer Z lays off or furloughs all of its employees. It does not pay wages to its employees for the time they are laid off or furloughed and not working, but it continues the employees‚Äô health care coverage. Employer Z‚Äôs health plan expenses allocable to the period its operations were partially suspended may be treated as qualified wages for purposes of the Employee Retention Credit.

title: 65. May an Eligible Employer that averaged more than 100 full-time employees in 2019 treat its health plan expenses as qualified wages for purposes of the Employee Retention Credit? (updated May 7, 2020)
content:
Yes. An Eligible Employer that averaged more than 100 full-time employees in 2019 may treat its health plan expenses paid or incurred, after March 12, 2020, and before January 1, 2021, allocable to the time that the employees are not providing services during any period in a calendar quarter in which the employer‚Äôs business operations are fully or partially suspended due to a governmental order or a calendar quarter in which the employer experiences a significant decline in gross receipts as qualified wages, subject to the maximum of $10,000 per employee for all calendar quarters for all qualified wages. However, an Eligible Employer may not treat health plan expenses allocable to the time for which the employees are receiving wages for providing services as qualified wages; only the portion of health plan expenses allocable to the time that the employees are not providing services are treated as qualified wages.
Example 1: Employer A averaged more than 100 full-time employees in 2019. Employer A is subject to a governmental order that partially suspends the operation of its trade or business. In response to the governmental order, Employer A reduces all employees‚Äô hours by 50 percent and pays wages to its employees only for the time that the employees are providing services, but Employer A continues to provide the employees with full health care coverage. Employer A‚Äôs health plan expenses allocable to the time that employees are not providing services may be treated as qualified wages. However, Employer A may not treat health plan expenses allocable to the time for which the employees are receiving wages for providing services as qualified wages.
Example 2: Employer B averaged more than 100 full-time employees in 2019. Employer B is subject to a governmental order that partially suspends the operations of its trade or business. In response to the governmental order, Employer B reduces its employees‚Äô hours by 50 percent, but it reduces its employees‚Äô wages by only 40 percent, so that the employees receive 60 percent of their wages for 50 percent of their normal hours. Employer B continues to cover 100 percent of the employees‚Äô health plan expenses. In this case, Employer B may treat as qualified wages: (i) the 10 percent of the wages that it pays employees for time the employees are not providing services, plus (ii) 50 percent of the health plan expenses, because the health plan expenses are allocable to the time that employees were not providing services.
Example 3: Employer C is subject to a governmental order that fully suspends the operations of its trade or business. Employer C lays off or furloughs its employees and does not pay wages to the employees, but does continue to cover 100 percent of the employees‚Äô health plan expenses. In this case, Employer C may treat as qualified wages the health plan expenses that are allocable to the time that the employees are not providing services.

title: 66. For an Eligible Employer that sponsors more than one plan for its employees (for example, both a group health plan and a health flexible spending arrangement (health FSA)), or more than one plan covering different employees, how are the qualified health plan expenses for each employee determined?
content: The qualified health plan expenses are determined separately for each plan. Then, for each plan, those expenses are allocated to the employees who participate in that plan. In the case of an employee who participates in more than one plan, the allocated expenses of each plan in which the employee participates are aggregated for that employee.

title: 67. For an Eligible Employer who sponsors a fully-insured group health plan, how are the qualified health plan expenses of that plan allocated to the qualified wages on a pro rata basis?
content:
An Eligible Employer who sponsors a fully-insured group health plan may use any reasonable method to determine and allocate the plan expenses, including (1) the COBRA applicable premium for the employee typically available from the insurer, (2) one average premium rate for all employees, or (3) a substantially similar method that takes into account the average premium rate determined separately for employees with self-only and other than self-only coverage.
If an Eligible Employer chooses to use one average premium rate for all employees, the allocable amount for each day an employee covered by the insured group health plan is entitled to qualified wages could be determined using the following steps:
The Eligible Employer‚Äôs overall annual premium for the employees covered by the policy is divided by the number of employees covered by the policy to determine the average annual premium per employee.
The average annual premium per employee is divided by the average number of work days during the year by all covered employees (treating days of paid leave as a work day and a work day as including any day on which work is performed) to determine the average daily premium per employee. For example, a full-year employee working five days per week may be treated as working 52 weeks x 5 days or 260 days. Calculations for part-time and seasonal employees who participate in the plan should be adjusted as appropriate. Eligible Employers may use any reasonable method for calculating part-time employee work days.
The resulting premium should be adjusted to reflect any portion that employees contribute after-tax.
The resulting amount is the amount allocated to each day of qualified wages.
Example: Employer D sponsors an insured group health plan that covers 400 employees, some with self-only coverage and some with family coverage. Each employee is expected to have 260 work days a year. (Five days a week for 52 weeks.) The employees contribute a portion of their premium by pre-tax salary reduction, with different amounts for self-only and family. The total annual premium for the 400 employees is $5.2 million. (This includes both the amount paid by the Eligible Employer and the amounts paid by employees through salary reduction.)
For an Eligible Employer using one average premium rate for all employees, the average annual premium rate is $5.2 million divided by 400, or $13,000. For each employee expected to have 260 work days a year, this results in a daily average premium rate equal to $13,000 divided by 260, or $50. That $50 is the amount of qualified health plan expenses allocated to each day of qualified wages per employee.

title: 68. For an Eligible Employer who sponsors a self-insured group health plan, how are the qualified health plan expenses of that plan allocated to the qualified wages on a pro rata basis?
content:
An Eligible Employer who sponsors a self-insured group health plan may use any reasonable method to determine and allocate the health plan expenses, including (1) the COBRA applicable premium for the employee typically available from the administrator, or (2) any reasonable actuarial method to determine the estimated annual expenses of the plan.
If the Eligible Employer uses a reasonable actuarial method to determine the estimated annual expenses of the plan, then rules similar to the rules for insured plans are used to determine the amount of health plan expenses allocated to an employee. That is, the estimated annual expense is divided by the number of employees covered by the plan, and that amount is divided by the average number of work days during the year by the employees (treating days of paid leave as work days and any day on which an employee performs any work as work days). The resulting amount is the amount allocated to each day of qualified wages. Adjustments should be made for employee after-tax contributions.

title: 69. For an Eligible Employer who sponsors a health savings account (HSA), or Archer Medical Saving Account (Archer MSA) and a high deductible health plan (HDHP), are contributions to the HSA or Archer MSA included in the qualified health plan expenses?
content: The amount of qualified health plan expenses does not include Eligible Employer contributions to HSAs or Archer MSAs. Eligible Employers who sponsor an HDHP should calculate the amount of qualified health plan expenses in the same manner as an insured group health plan, or a self-insured plan, as applicable.

title: 70. For an Eligible Employer who sponsors a health reimbursement arrangement (HRA), a health flexible spending arrangement (health FSA), or a qualified small employer health reimbursement arrangement (QSEHRA), are contributions to the HRA, health FSA, or QSEHRA included in the qualified health plan expenses?
content: The amount of qualified health plan expenses may include contributions to an HRA (including an individual coverage HRA), or a health FSA, but does not include contributions to a QSEHRA. To allocate contributions to an HRA or a health FSA, Eligible Employers should use the amount of contributions made on behalf of the particular employee.

title: 71. Are qualified health plan expenses allocable to qualified leave wages excluded from the definition of qualified wages?
content: Yes. Wages for which an Eligible Employer may claim the Employee Retention Credit do not include the qualified sick leave and qualified family leave wages for which it claims credit under the FFCRA. This exclusion also applies to the qualified health plan expenses that are allocable to these qualified leave wages.

title: Founder Discusses Challenges of Hyper-Growth and Commitment to Social Impact in B2B Podcast Interview
content:
Apr 18 2018 | Podcast
Embedded video player.

title: Episode Overview
content:
In this insightful B2B podcast episode, host James Carberry interviews Anupam Satyasheel, founder and chief enterprise officer at Occams Advisory, delving into the intricacies of managing hyper-growth in business.
Anupam candidly discusses four key challenges faced during rapid expansion: accepting imperfection, retaining talent, managing cash flow, and navigating complex regulations. Beyond business, Anupam shares a deeply personal commitment to philanthropy, highlighting his involvement in a charity dedicated to children's social, psychological, and educational needs across seven countries. His inspiring journey from humble beginnings in rural India underscores his passion for leaving a positive impact on the world. Listeners gain valuable insights into the dynamic interplay between business growth, social responsibility, and personal fulfillment.

title: Episode Overview
content:
This webinar provides insights into a detailed discussion on eligibility analysis, compliance validation, and fee structures for services related to tax credits such as ERC (Employee Retention Credit) and R&D (Research and Development) tax credit. It outlines the process, requirements, and fees involved in assisting clients with eligibility assessments, compliance validations, and audit advisories.

title: Episode Overview
content:
In this insightful podcast episode, Anupam Satyasheel, founder and CEO of Occams Advisory, delves into his entrepreneurial journey, beginning with his transition from Wall Street to establishing a firm that brings Fortune 500 expertise to SMBs.
He discusses the pivotal moments, including the 2008 financial crisis, that propelled him to start his venture, emphasizing fintech innovation, particularly in high-risk merchant accounts and multicurrency solutions. Anupam highlights the company's core values, underscoring a commitment to employee welfare, ethical business practices, and community support. He passionately shares how Occams Advisory stands out by not just focusing on profit but also on creating a positive impact, fostering a culture of gratitude, and continuously innovating to stay ahead in the ever-evolving fintech landscape.

Unlocking Business Potential: Understanding the Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERC) with Occams Advisory
content:
Apr 17 2023 | Podcast
[Video player graphic with 0:00 timestamp]

title: Episode Overview
content:
The interview featuring David King from Occams Advisory, shedding light on the Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERC). In a conversation with radio hosts, King outlines the intricacies of ERC, emphasizing its role in rewarding businesses for retaining employees during the pandemic.

He clarifies misconceptions surrounding ERC, emphasizing it as a legitimate IRS program aimed at aiding businesses. The interview elucidates ERC's eligibility criteria, including W2 employee requirements and revenue decline benchmarks. Notably, it distinguishes ERC from the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP), highlighting ERC's cash refund nature versus PPP's loan structure. Throughout, the interview advocates for businesses to leverage Occams Advisory's expertise in navigating ERC application processes, offering a glimpse into the program's potential benefits.

title: Amber Kellogg at Occams Advisory: Bridging Innovation and Simplicity in Business Solutions
content:
Nov 20 2023 | Podcast

Video player embedded.

title: Episode Overview
content:
An Interesting conversation between Amber E Kellogg and Laura Often from Zen Media, focusing on Amber's background, her role at Occams Advisory, and the services Occams provides. Amber shares her extensive career across different sectors, emphasizing her problem-solving skills and passion for businesses.

She discusses Occams Advisory's ethos, which is inspired by Occams Razor, aiming to provide simple solutions to complex problems. Amber highlights her transition to focusing on affiliate partnerships while still engaging in client management. The conversation covers market trends, the impact of the pandemic on businesses, the importance of digital transformation, AI, and maintaining a human touch in services. Amber passionately speaks about the challenges their clients face, such as market volatility, digital transformation, and the need for effective financial planning and capital management. She also touches on corporate social responsibility and Occams Advisory's global impact, showcasing her commitment to both professional and ethical standards in business.

content:

Apr 25 2019 | Podcast
Video Player

title: Episode Overview
content:
Anupam Satyasheel, a former Wall Street investment banker turned successful entrepreneur, shares his journey, highlighting pivotal tough decisions he faced along the way. From breaking his own hiring rules to offering a friend a job to diversifying his company's services for more stable income,
Anupam provides valuable insights into the challenges and triumphs of entrepreneurship. He emphasizes the importance of embracing humility and being willing to adapt, even if it means stepping out of one's comfort zone. Through thoughtful decision-making strategies and a commitment to leveraging technology effectively,
Anupam demonstrates how resilience and vision can lead to sustainable business growth. Readers gain practical wisdom and inspiration for their own entrepreneurial endeavors.

content:
This webinar highlights a discussion led by Chris, Occams Advisory's National Sales Director, and Amber, regarding various business solutions offered by the company. Chris shares insights on the self-employment tax credit (STC), emphasizing its potential benefits for self-employed individuals impacted by COVID-19.
He emphasizes the importance of networking, referrals, and proactive outreach in leveraging these solutions effectively. The discussion also touches on audit advisory and tax amendments to ensure tax compliance. Throughout the webinar, the focus remains on empowering affiliates to foster mutually beneficial relationships and drive success through innovative solutions. Attendees are encouraged to engage in discussions and leverage OccamsAdvisory's expertise to amplify their brands and achieve growth.

content: Back to Podcast & Webinar button. Mar 25 2024 | Podcast. Share icon. Bookmark icon. Video player.

title: Episode Overview
content: A detailed conversation by Amber E Kellogg concerning tax considerations for small businesses. Amber emphasizes the importance of staying informed about tax deadlines, maintaining accurate records, and seeking professional assistance for complex tax situations. She discusses various tax credits and deductions available to business owners, such as the Research and Development (R&D) credit, self-employment tax credit, and Employee Retention Credit (ERC). The conversation also delves into choosing between tax software and hiring a tax specialist, considering factors like complexity, cost, and long-term planning. Overall, it provides comprehensive insights into navigating tax obligations and maximizing benefits for small businesses.

content:
In this insightful discussion, CEO Anupam Satyasheel shares strategies for businesses to enhance efficiency and competitiveness. He emphasizes the importance of adopting a virtual-first approach, leveraging technology, and being selective when hiring talent.

Anupam highlights the significance of timing in optimizing work output and fostering transparent metrics for tracking progress. Instead of simply firing employees who may not fit, he advocates for clear conversations to help them find better opportunities elsewhere.

Anupam also explores the potential of tapping into global talent pools, such as in India. Overall, his insights provide valuable guidance for organizations aiming to thrive in today's dynamic business landscape.

content: Date: Jan 29 2024 | Type: Podcast. Includes a video player. Share and bookmark icons are present.

title: Episode Overview
content:
A podcast episode from PayPod, hosted by Jacob Halal, who interviews Anupam Satyasheel, the founder and CEO of Occams Advisory. Anupam shares his journey from working on Wall Street to founding Occams Advisory in 2012, aiming to bring Fortune 500 expertise to SMBs.

He discusses the inspiration behind the company, its evolution, and the pivot from various business ideas to establishing a firm that offers a wide range of services, including investment banking, insurance, fintech platforms like Equip, and professional services. Anupam emphasizes the importance of being technology-driven, automating processes, and the company's unique approach to managing high-risk payment processing. He also highlights Occams Advisory's strong mission statement, culture of gratitude, and the principle-driven approach that has helped retain employees and satisfy clients.

title: Pandemic Challenges and Remote Work Revolution: Anupam Satyasheel Discusses Changing Business Dynamics
content:
Mar 08 2023 | Podcast
< Back to Podcast & Webinar
Video Player

title: Episode Overview
content:
In this enlightening discussion, Anupam Satyasheel delves into the transformative effects of the pandemic on business operations. He explores the evolving landscape of financial systems, citing challenges like inflation and the emergence of cryptocurrencies. Satyasheel emphasizes the shift towards decentralized workforces and questions traditional office-based practices due to remote work capabilities.
Drawing from real-world examples, he underscores the importance of companies adapting to retain talent and foster a culture of innovation. Through anecdotes from a conversation with a CPA firm principal, Satyasheel highlights the changing dynamics of employee loyalty and productivity in a remote work environment. Ultimately, he advocates for a reevaluation of traditional business paradigms to embrace the opportunities presented by the pandemic-induced changes.

title: Rescued: Small Businesses Found Hope Through ERC
content: Dec 15 2023 | Podcast. Video player for the podcast. Share and Bookmark icons.

title: Episode Overview
content:
In this heartfelt conversation, Anupam Satyasheel sheds light on the challenges faced by small businesses burdened with high levels of debt. Amidst this financial distress, government aid emerges as a beacon of hope. Anupam shares touching anecdotes of businesses receiving relief checks, which bring about tears of happiness and relief.

These funds enable struggling businesses to retain their operations and support their employees, sparing them from the fear of unemployment. He emphasizes the profound reward of witnessing the positive impact of this assistance on both businesses and their employees. Additionally, Anupam extends a call to action, urging anyone aware of eligible businesses to explore the possibility of accessing this vital aid. Through empathy and support, these initiatives serve as lifelines for businesses navigating turbulent times.

title: Mastering IRS Updates & Corporate Transparency: Insights from Occams Advisory
content:
Back to Podcast & Webinar
May 12 2024 | Podcast
[Video Player]

title: Episode Overview
content: This webinar focuses on the latest IRS updates for the current year and explores various aspects of the Corporate Transparency Act (CTA). Amber introduces the expert panel from Occams Advisory, including Anupam (CEO and Founder), David King (Deputy CEO), Nadine (Corporate Counsel), Priyanka (AVP Finance), Rajat (VP,) and Josh (Chief Revenue Officer). Each panelist shares their expertise on the CTA and highlights its benefits for businesses filing with Occams Advisory. The webinar also sheds light on critical topics such as the Congressional Constituent Request, the process of suing the IRS for refund processing, and key compliance requirements and deadlines for Beneficial Ownership Transparency Reporting. With insights from affiliates and clients who participated, the session emphasizes how Occams Advisory's advanced AI tools and streamlined compliance processes ensure a win-win outcome for businesses.

title: Episode Overview
content:
This thought leadership discussion introduces John Bruner and Laura Often from Zen Media and discusses the current focus and challenges in tax advisory, particularly in research and development (R&D) tax credits.
John Bruner shares insights into why businesses often miss out on R&D tax credits, the impact of AI on business innovation, and the specifics of recent legislative changes affecting tax strategies. The conversation also covers the importance of specialization in business today, the value of partnerships in the advisory sector, and John's professional pride in helping clients improve profitability and operational efficiency.

title: Episode Overview
content:
This Video highlights a Occams' commitment to accuracy and reliability in helping people with their taxes. Anupam emphasizes the complexity of tax filing and the importance of getting it right, noting the involvement of tax attorneys and CPAs to ensure correctness every time.
He reassures clients by offering various assurances, including standing behind their work, providing all necessary documentation, and offering support in case of an audit. Furthermore, the service pledges to defend clients if needed and refund their share if any mistakes occur. This level of accountability is emphasized as uncommon in the financial services industry, underscoring the service's confidence in its ability to deliver accurate and dependable tax assistance to its clients.

title: Occams Insights Ensures Real Connections and Results for Clients' Claims Processing
content: Dec 15 2023 | Podcast | Video player

title: Episode Overview
content: In their engaging discussion, Anupam Satyasheel highlights Occams‚Äô unique approach to claims processing, ensuring clients receive their rightful funds while adhering to regulations. He stresses the importance of personal interaction, offering assurance that clients will speak with real people rather than automated systems. With pride, he shares success stories, noting that two clients have successfully navigated audits and received their money as a result. This track record instills confidence in potential clients, assuring them of comprehensive support and answers to their queries. Despite Occams‚Äô technological prowess, Anupam Satyasheel prioritizes genuine human interaction, even though Occams have developed a chatbot for addressing Employee Retention Credit (ERC) inquiries. Occams‚Äô commitment to innovation and personalized attention sets them apart, effectively meeting clients' needs.

title: Intrapreneurial Insights: Navigating Digital Marketing Evolution and Decoding the Nature of Money with Bitcoin
Episode Overview
content:
This conversation captures a thought leadership discussion between Mukarram Dhorajiwala and Laura Often from Zen Media focused on two main paradigms: the evolving digital marketing landscape, particularly compliance and technology changes, and a deep dive into the nature of money, with a specific emphasis on Bitcoin.

Mukarram, acting as an intrapreneur, explores complex problems through the lens of exponential technologies, notably blockchain and cryptocurrency, asserting Bitcoin's unique value among these. He also discusses the conventional role of money, questioning its centralized nature and highlighting Bitcoin's potential to disrupt traditional financial systems. Additionally, the conversation touches on Mukarram‚Äôs background in finance and economics, his extensive self-driven research into monetary systems, and his intent to demystify the concept of money for the broader public.

Unlocking Financial Support: Small Businesses Explore Employee Retention Tax Credits
content:
Dec 14 2023 | Podcast
Video player for the podcast episode.

title: Episode Overview
content:
Tune into the Greater South Florida Chamber radio program as host John Kroll interviews Josh Westfall from Occams Advisory to demystify the Employee Retention Credit (ERC) program for small businesses.
This program, born from the 2020 CARES Act, rewards businesses for retaining employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. Unlike PPP loans, ERC is a refundable tax credit based on wages paid to employees.
Westfall explains eligibility criteria, including significant declines in gross receipts or suspension orders due to the pandemic. Small businesses can receive up to $26,000 per employee, providing crucial financial support without repayment obligations. To explore qualifications and benefits, businesses are encouraged to contact Occams Advisory or visit their website.

title: Episode Overview
content:
In a lively radio discussion, Amber E Kellogg shed light on the Employee Retention Credit (ERC) and its potential benefits for businesses navigating the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Hosted on a Saturday morning show, the conversation delves into the intricacies of ERC eligibility, clarifying misconceptions and addressing common concerns. Amber Kellogg, from Occams Advisory, breaks down the criteria for ERC qualification, emphasizing that even profitable businesses during the pandemic may still be eligible. The conversation also addresses the interaction between ERC and other relief programs like the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP).

Listeners are encouraged to reach out for further assistance, as the experts aim to empower businesses with crucial tax knowledge and guidance during these uncertain times

content:

title: Episode Overview
content:
The webinar discussed the Employee Retention Credit (ERC) for small businesses, a tax credit available to those who retained employees during COVID-19. Experts emphasized the importance of seeking accurate information due to the process's complexity.

Businesses must tie factors like revenue decline to executive orders to qualify. Partnering with knowledgeable experts can help navigate the process effectively. Many businesses may qualify, but face challenges in applying alone. Deadlines vary for different quarters in 2020 and 2021. Overall, the webinar aimed to provide clarity and assistance to small businesses seeking to maximize the ERC.

content:
In this episode, Kay interviews Amber Kellogg, VP of Affiliate Origination and Management at Occams Advisory. Amber shares her remarkable career journey, starting from managing divisions at The Limited, including Victoria's Secret, to becoming a pivotal figure in relationship management at J.P. Morgan Chase and eventually landing at Occams Advisory.

Her story highlights overcoming challenges in a male-dominated industry and the importance of continuous self-improvement. Amber emphasizes that in sales at Occams Advisory, personal integrity and relationship-building are as crucial as the services offered, reflecting her philosophy that success hinges on both the product and the person selling it.

title: Episode Overview
content:
In this insightful conversation, Anupam Satyasheel, a seasoned business leader, shares invaluable insights on the critical importance of continuous learning and adaptability in today's rapidly evolving business landscape.

Anupam emphasizes the necessity for entrepreneurs and business leaders to stay updated with industry trends and developments, particularly amidst the fast pace of technological advancements. He highlights the transformative power of investing in reputable sources and paid subscriptions for enhanced insights.

Furthermore, Anupam discusses the significance of surrounding oneself with complementary talents and the need to anticipate and prepare for unforeseen events, or "black swan" events, that can disrupt businesses. Through anecdotes and reflections, he underscores the vital role of innovation, collaboration, and a thirst for knowledge in navigating uncertainties and driving sustained success in the ever-changing business world.

title: Featured Team Members
content:
Meet the Experts Behind Our Success: Leaders in Innovation and Strategy

title: Anupam Satyasheel
content:
Founder
Anupam founded Occams Advisory in 2011 and has served as the CEO since 2012. Anupam has advised many CEOs and boards. Under his leadership, Occams has achieved exceptional results for its clients across industries and geographies. Prior to founding Occams, Anupam spent over half a decade on Wall Street with names like Barclays, Merrill Lynch, Scotia Capital et al.
Anupam lives and works from Long Beach, CA with his physician wife and two boys. He spends his evenings balancing professional after-hours with baseball and golf with his boys, culinary experiments with his family and deep dive into books on growth, success, and astrophysics. Anupam also serves on the boards of Child Literacy and The Blossom Project, charities dedicated to providing educational opportunities to children in need.
Follow on Linked In

title: Supriya Oberoi
content:
Executive Advisor ‚Äì Marketing & Branding
Supriya is an experienced marketing and strategy professional with extensive experience in global marketing and expansion, brand/product management, strategy development, market research and consulting within the consumer goods, fashion / retail, education, and pharmaceutical industries. At Occams, Supriya often engages as a subject matter expert and key advisor to clients on their crucial marketing and branding initiatives.
Some of Supriya‚Äôs key specialties include brand management, new product launch, global brand expansion, digital marketing, public relations and social media, marketing plan development, marketing campaign development, portfolio optimization, primary and secondary research, competitive assessment, pricing, market entry strategies, market and opportunity assessments, retail store expansion and in-store merchandising.
Supriya holds Bachelor in Business Studies from the College of Business Studies, University of Delhi and a Master in Business Administration from the Darden School of Business, University of Virginia. Supriya is a travel and culinary enthusiast. She lives in New York City.
Follow on Linked In

title: Ramki Ramanarayanan
content:
Divisional CEO
For almost 20 years, Ramki has served with distinction in investment banking, private equity, and financial strategy. Ramki leads Occams Capital providing acquisition-driven growth, capital raising, joint venture and owner-exit strategies. With execution track record of over $2 billion in investment banking and PE transactions, including middle-market and lower middle-market M&A and capital raising, private equity portfolio management, and debt and equity public offerings, Ramki‚Äôs alma maters include Wells Fargo Securities, Robert W. Baird & Co and Current Capital.
Ramki holds an undergraduate degree in production engineering and an MBA from the Fuqua School of Business at Duke University. Ramki‚Äôs current and previous non-profit affiliations include Child Rights & You, Teach for America, Chicago, and Working In The Schools. Ramki and his wife live in Chicago, where they enjoy balancing the intense work life with solitude in nature.
Follow on Linked In

title: David King
content:

title: COVID-19-Related Employee Retention Credits: Special Issues for Employees: Income and Deduction FAQs
content: Back to index

title: 84. Are qualified wages excluded from gross income as "qualified disaster relief payments"?
content:
No. Section 139 of the Internal Revenue Code (the "Code") excludes from a taxpayer's gross income certain payments to individuals to reimburse or pay for expenses related to a qualified disaster ("qualified disaster relief payments"). Although the COVID-19 outbreak is a "qualified disaster" for purposes of section 139 the Code, qualified wages are not excludible qualified disaster relief payments, because qualified wages are what an individual would otherwise earn as compensation, rather than payments to offset any particular expenses that an individual would incur due to COVID-19.
Section 139(c)(2) of the Code provides that for purposes of section 139 of the Code, the term "qualified disaster" includes a disaster determined by the President to warrant assistance by the Federal government under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, 42 U.S.C. 5121-5207. The President has made such a disaster determination for all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and all U.S. Territories. A "qualified disaster relief payment" is defined by section 139(b) of the Code to include any amount paid to or for the benefit of an individual to reimburse or pay reasonable and necessary personal, family, living, or funeral expenses incurred as a result of a qualified disaster. Qualified disaster relief payments do not include qualified wages paid by an employer, even those that are paid when an employee is not providing services.

title: Beneficial Ownership Information Report
content: Effective January 1st, 2024 most companies are required to report their beneficial owner to the U.S. Treasury's Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN). This means you must identify and document any person who holds a 25% or greater ownership interest or exercises substantial control over a company. The BOI report filing, due on March 21, 2025 (passed as of March 25, 2025; no penalties enforced) and FinCEN has stated that the filing date is firm. Currently, no penalties are being enforced for missing the March 21, 2025, deadline, per FinCEN's announcement. Due to ongoing litigation, future deadlines may change; check FinCEN updates for the latest information.

title: How BOI Reporting Works
content: We help you get complaint and stay compliant

title: Step 1 - Enter Your Company's Information
content: BOI Reporting provides a user-friendly interface with tips, commentary, and round the clock customer support to help you input the required information about your Company, Company Applicants and Beneficial Owners.

title: Step 2 - File Your Beneficial Ownership Information Report
content: Reports are submitted directly to FinCEN electronically through an automated process, using cutting-edge technology that makes your filing fast, safe, and efficient. BOI Reporting does not store or sell your sensitive data.

title: Step 3 - Receive Confirmation and Reminders
content: We will provide you with the FinCEN confirmation number for your records. After your filing is confirmed, BOI Reporting will periodically send you updates and reminders to help you stay compliant.

Digital presence and social media are essential for a company to connect with its audience, build brand identity, and drive growth. A strong digital presence involves having a well-designed website, optimizing for search engines, and maintaining accurate online listings. This ensures a company is easily discoverable and establishes credibility.

It helps build relationships, share content, and gather insights into customer preferences. At Occams Advisory, we integrate our digital presence with social media to create a cohesive brand experience, enhancing visibility, customer engagement, and loyalty.
In today's digital landscape, a strong digital presence and active social media strategy are crucial for companies to succeed, working together to increase visibility, foster engagement, and drive business success.

title: Life Biography
content: Anupam Satyasheel is a forward-thinking entrepreneur and the Founder and CEO of Occams Advisory, a global financial advisory firm that champions the growth of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) across various sectors. With his leadership, Occams has garnered prestigious recognitions, including listings on the Inc Fastest 5000, FT America's Fastest 500, and Fortune magazine's 300 Most Innovative Companies. Holding an MBA from New York University, with a semester at London Business School, Anupam's academic pursuits in Finance & Economics have laid a solid foundation for his professional journey. His Wall Street tenure at renowned institutions like Barclays, Bank of America Merrill Lynch, and The Bank of Nova Scotia equipped him with the insights and experience to identify the unique challenges faced by SMEs, inspiring the creation of Occams Advisory. Beyond his corporate achievements, Anupam is deeply committed to social and educational initiatives. He serves as a co-founder and executive director of Child Literacy, actively contributing to projects that support educational opportunities for underprivileged children. His engagement with non-profit organizations emphasizes his dedication to leveraging business success for broader societal impact. Residing in Long Beach, CA, with his family, Anupam leads a balanced life, dedicating his time to both his professional endeavors and personal interests. He actively participates in sports with his sons, experiments with cooking, and indulges in reading on topics ranging from personal growth to astrophysics. This harmonious blend of activities reflects his belief in the importance of continuous learning and self-improvement. Anupam's multifaceted career, marked by significant achievements in the financial sector and impactful contributions to social causes, showcases his commitment to empowering SMEs and fostering educational opportunities. His leadership at Occams Advisory and his philanthropic efforts demonstrate a steadfast dedication to creating a legacy of innovation, empowerment, and sustainable success.

title: Life Biography
content:
Priyanka Bathwal fell in love with accounting in 2004, and since then, it's been a happily ever after story. Her passion for accounting stems from her curiosity to solve problems. As the AVP-Finance at Occams Advisory, she collaborates with senior management to oversee the company's finances, including budgeting, forecasting, internal controls, and financial reporting. Priyanka completed her professional studies by passing the CPA exam in the USA and the Chartered Accountancy exam in India. Her experience in diversified roles such as tax specialist, statutory auditor, and financial analyst has given her a well-rounded perspective on financial management.

Dancing brings Priyanka joy and helps her stay fit. Although she considers herself a bad but enthusiastic painter and portraitist, she enjoys the creative process. title: Life Biography
content:
David exemplifies a leader focused on results and growth, blending strategic acumen with a track record of execution. Currently serving as the Deputy CEO at Occams Advisory, his extensive experience in global banking across Europe laid the foundation for his entrepreneurial journey in the United States.

David's lateral thinking adds valuable perspectives to our strategic vision, contributing significantly to our client's growth trajectory.

David is a strong believer in self growth and that to succeed one needs to constantly evolve and invest in self growth. He is an avid believer that whatever topic you wish to master from quantum physics to complicated financial models, someone "has come before you" and has invested thousands of man hours mastering the topic that you can read in a book in 10 hours or less. David is an avid sports fan and enjoys nothing more than watching his sons from the side of the field. His favorite downtime is spending time in the tranquil stunning waters of the Gulf of Mexico in Florida.

title: Life Biography
content: Nitin Kumar Aggarwal is an accomplished entrepreneur and seasoned executive, currently serving as the CEO of Occams Advisory's India operations. Based in New Delhi, Nitin has significantly influenced the company's strategic direction, leading it to be recognized among Fortune's top 300 innovative companies and securing placements in FT America's Fastest 500 and the Inc Fastest 5000 for four consecutive years. Nitin's academic background is robust, completing his Accelerated General Management Program at the prestigious Indian Institute of Management - Ahmedabad. He also holds an MBA from UPES, Dehradun. His foundational training in Information Technology was acquired at the Indian Institute of Information Technology, Allahabad, where he completed his Bachelor of Technology. Professionally, Nitin started his journey as a proprietor, launching Rishikon Solutions from a small home office and scaling it into a thriving business with a team of over 50, achieving top-tier affiliate status on Clickbank.com. His entrepreneurial spirit flourished further when he founded 247 Experts Pvt Ltd, transforming it from a modest team of six to a powerhouse of over hundred professionals and pioneering industry standard KPIs. Nitin has experience in a diverse array of industries, each enriching him with a unique blend of insights and expertise. His extensive involvement in various business sectors has endowed him with a rare and comprehensive business acumen. At Occams Advisory, Nitin has been instrumental in setting up and architecting the Equipay platform, among other significant projects. His role at Occams not only encompasses technical excellence but also extends to financial planning, innovation, and strategic growth. His goal at Occams Advisory is to make it a tech-first company and set new standards. Outside of his professional arena, Nitin likes to focus on his family, and the extended circle, and enjoys reading. He has keen interest in Indian mythology and Vedic origins. His personal life is deeply rooted in Dehradun, where he contributes to local community initiatives, showcasing a commitment to leveraging his business acumen for broader societal benefits.

title: Life Biography
content:
Mukarram Dhorajiwala is the Co-Founder of Minecodes, an ITeS company established in 2015, specializing in technology and knowledge outsourcing. In 2021, Mukarram led a strategic merger with Occams Advisory Inc., North America's fastest-growing MSME, driving the company to new heights.

Accolades and Impact: Under Mukarram's leadership, the company earned Fortune's distinguished award for "America's Most Innovative Companies 2023." This accolade reflects his dedication to business and brand development, and his ability to craft compelling narratives that resonate in today's dynamic business environment.

Versatile Expertise: With an extensive background in Business Development, Brand Development, Product Innovation, and Digital Business Strategy, Mukarram excels at navigating complexities and shaping transformative solutions. His diverse skills include Paid and Organic Marketing, Process Innovation, and comprehensive Product and Market Research.

Holistic Skill Set: Mukarram's expertise spans multiple disciplines, including Software and Web Development, Marketing, User Experience Design, Finance, and R&D. This comprehensive skill set allows him to approach challenges from various angles, turning obstacles into opportunities.

Thought Leadership: Beyond his executive role, Mukarram is a thought leader who shares insights on Bitcoin, human interactions, brand building, and technology through his Substack. He invites others to join him in a journey of continuous learning and thought-provoking discussions.

Educational Foundation: Mukarram holds a management degree with a major in Economics and Business Management from the University of Mumbai. This academic background informs his strategic approach to solving business challenges.

Passions and Personal Life: A devoted husband and doting father to a 3-year-old, Mukarram balances his professional life with a rich personal life. His passions include astrophysics, electronic music, breakthrough technology, economics, and politics. As a branding enthusiast, he finds joy in creating impactful narratives that resonate with discerning audiences.

Based Canada, Mukarram operates at the intersection of innovation and opportunity. Let's connect to explore cutting-edge business and technology.

title: ERC Audit Advisory For 2024
content: Book Free Consultation button. Find out if you qualify! (form heading) Form fields: Have you claimed the ERC? (Options: Yes, No, Unsure); Have you received an audit or IDR from the IRS regarding your ERC? (Options: Yes, No, Unsure); How many quarters did you claim? (Checkboxes: Q2 2020, Q3 2020, Q4 2020, Q1 2021, Q2 2021, Q3 2021); In what state is the primary business located? (Dropdown with all US states, e.g., Alabama, Alaska, Arizona... Wyoming); Who helped you claim the ERC? (Input fields: Company Name*, Full Name*, Email*, Phone); Submit button.

title: Occams ERC Audit Advisory:
content: Image: Hand interacting with 'RISK MANAGEMENT' digital interface. Our ERC Audit Advisory includes leading risk management strategies and processes Occams deploys to manage the risk that either an ineligible employer has claimed ERC, or the amounts claimed are not per the guidance provided by lawmakers and the program's agent IRS. In recognition of the extraordinary challenges faced by ERC advisory service providers, Occams has developed for all ERC claimants, expertise directly related to the response to, and managing various ERC audit risks up to the tax court.

title: Scope of Audit Advisory:
content: We will be offering specifically trained research analysts, and subject matter specialists dedicated to the ERC Program. Our services will include: 1. Review of ERC computations, including adjustments of PPP loan/s (if applicable), exclusion of majority owners' family members' payroll from ERC eligible payroll, and all other statutory adjustments. 2. Preliminary assessment of eligibility based on criteria as available under the Program. 3. Conduct detailed interview with You to establish ERC eligibility and compilation of metrics as evidence for eligibility. 4. Extending audit support for the maximum period of potential audit by IRS.

title: Talk with our Tax Experts today!
content: Payroll providers and other professionals do not have the time to dive into the legislation and other moving parts of the ERC program. That is why we put together a team of dedicated tax professionals who can work with business owners and financial officers to ensure you receive the maximum benefit from this important, but often misunderstood relief program. So, even if you already got an opinion from another tax professional, we encourage you to spend 15 minutes with our team for trusted due diligence on your eligibility for ERC and why you may be entitled even if you did not experience a drop in revenue. Book Free Consultation button. Profiles: Anupam Satyasheel (Founder, with image), David King (Deputy CEO, with image), Josh Westfall (Chief Revenue Officer ‚Äì Tax Advisory, with image), Amber E Kellogg (VP - Affiliate Origination & Management, with image).

title: Our Empowered Team
content: We believe in engaging people who are instinctively inclined to support our clients and yet challenge them to superior levels. Our people measure our success by a singular yardstick ‚Äì the measurable impact of our services to our clients. We strive to build a work-culture where client‚Äôs success is synonymous with ours. We believe that success is to do the right things for our clients, our people and our communities. Our team consists of smart, driven individuals prioritizing output and getting work done. We value the relationships that we build. Unless we can become an extension of our clients‚Äô agenda and expectations, we consider ourselves sub-optimal in our efforts. title: Strategic Leadership & Articulate Thinking (SLAT)
content: This is the top-level leadership group responsible for setting the strategic direction of the organization. They articulate the vision and mission of the organization and ensure that all groups align with this strategic direction in belief and execution. View Members

title: Leadership Advisory Board for Scalability (LABS)
content: LABS advises the SLAT on highest organizational priorities and continuously changing regulatory, technological, and economic landscape. They provide insights and recommendations on how to scale the organization effectively and efliciently. View Members

title: Management, Execution, and Tactical Scalability (METS)
content: This group is responsible for the dayto-day management of the organization. They execute the strategies set by the SLAT and advised by the LABS. title: Maria Antonio
content: AVP - Client Relations "One of my most memorable moments at Occams Advisory was the realization that I would be working with a corporate company that offered numerous benefits and opportunities for professional growth. It was a moment of excitement and anticipation as I envisioned the possibilities for my career development and personal advancement within the organization. This realization marked a significant turning point in my professional journey, as I recognized the potential for learning, advancement, and long-term stability that Occams Advisory offers. It was a moment filled with hope and optimism for the future, knowing that I had found a company where I could thrive and achieve my career aspirations. Since that moment, I have been grateful for the support, mentorship, and opportunities for growth that Occams Advisory has provided. It has been a fulfilling experience, and I look forward to continuing to learn, evolve, and contribute to the success of the company in the years to come."

title: Leadership Advisory Board for Scalability (LABS)
content: LABS advises the SLAT on highest organizational priorities and continuously changing regulatory, technological, and economic landscape. They provide insights and recommendations on how to scale the organization effectively and efliciently.

title: Strategic Leadership & Articulate Thinking (SLAT)
content: This is the top-level leadership group responsible for setting the strategic direction of the organization. They articulate the vision and mission of the organization and ensure that all groups align with this strategic direction in belief and execution.

title: Leadership Advisory Board for Scalability (LABS)
content: LABS advises the SLAT on highest organizational priorities and continuously changing regulatory, technological, and economic landscape. They provide insights and recommendations on how to scale the organization effectively and efliciently.

title: Management, Execution, and Tactical Scalability (METS)
content: This group is responsible for the dayto-day management of the organization. They execute the strategies set by the SLAT and advised by the LABS. They also handle tactical scalability, ensuring that the organization can adapt and scale in response to changes in the business environment.

title: Scalability, Technology, Efficiency & Productivity (STEP)
content: This group focuses on the technological aspects of scalability agenda. They work on improving ef eficiency and productivity leveraging most effective and advanced technological adoption across aspects of the organization.

title: Client Origination & Relationship Enhancement (CORE)
content: CORE is responsible for client acquisition and relationship management. They work on originating new client relationships and enhancing existing ones. This includes establishing and following methodology to capture, measure and enhance client experience journey.

title: Channel Affiliate Recruiting & Engagement (CARE)
content: This group focuses on the technological aspects of scalability agenda. They work on improving efficiency and productivity leveraging most effective and advanced technological adoption across aspects of the organization.

title: Finance, Accounting, Risk & Legal (FARL)
content: The FARL division at Occam's Advisory consists of dedicated professionals in finance, risk management, accounting, and legal, ensuring operational excellence and propel business success.

title: Radhika Garg
content:
Analyst - Finance & Accounting
Radhika is a highly skilled finance professional with a talent for financial analysis and auditing. Since September 2023, she has been a key member of the team at Occams Advisory, utilizing her strong analytical abilities to provide valuable financial insights. Prior to this, Radhika honed her expertise in auditing as a Chartered Accountant at Grant Thornton Bharat LLP for over two years. Starting in October 2021, this experience equipped her with a deep understanding of accounting principles and risk assessment. The foundation of Radhika's financial acumen was laid during her three-year tenure as an Articled Assistant at VANG & CO. from 2015 to 2018. This role provided her with invaluable practical experience in the intricacies of financial reporting and compliance. Academically, Radhika holds a coveted Chartered Accountant designation from the esteemed Institute of Chartered Accountants of India, achieved in July 2021. Additionally, she holds a Master of Commerce degree in Commerce from Indira Gandhi National Open University, completed in December 2019. This blend of academic excellence, hands-on experience, and continuous professional development positions Radhika as a valuable asset in the financial services industry.

title: Shubham Maddheshiya
content:
Analyst - Finance & Accounting
Shubham is a highly motivated finance professional with over 4 years of combined experience in accounting, auditing, and financial reporting. Currently, Shubham thrives as an Account Specialist at Occam's Advisory (remote), managing Accounts Payable and Receivable while utilizing expertise in Microsoft Excel and QuickBooks Online. Prior to this role, Shubham assisted with due diligence and GST filings as an Audit Assistant at Dhandhania & Associates (Kolkata). Shubham further honed his skills through a 3-year internship as an Article Assistant at Chatterjee & Co. (Kolkata), gaining valuable experience in internal audit, statutory audit, and direct taxation. Shubham possesses strong leadership and financial reporting skills, and is eager to leverage them in a dynamic and growth-oriented environment.

title: Shivang Sabharwal
content:
Analyst - Finance & Accounting
Shivang is a driven Finance Specialist with over a year of experience at Occam's Advisory, leveraging his strong foundation in statutory audits, tax accounting, and various financial skills to contribute to the team's success. Prior to his current role, Shivang honed his research and communication skills during a 3-year internship as an Article Assistant at Jain & Associates. This experience equipped him to effectively analyze information and translate it into clear, concise writing. Shivang's academic background reflects his dedication to financial expertise. He holds a B.Com (Hons.) in Accounting and Finance from GGDSD College, graduating with an impressive 83% average. Following that, he completed the Chartered Accountancy program at the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India, clearing the rigorous CA Final exam in his first attempt. This achievement demonstrates his ability to excel under pressure and grasp complex financial concepts.

title: Vardhman Shah
content: COO (Chief Operating Officer). Vardhman has a successful record in converting concepts into results. Across his stints in heading business operations and a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and financial services industry, he has excelled in creating results while balancing abstract ideas from leadership and ground level challenges from rank and file. With exceptional skills in negotiation, customer acquisition, sales & sales operations, and customer satisfaction, Vardhman brings organized coherence to Occams‚Äô execution support team. Vardhman holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Financial Market & Wealth Management from LN College of Management Studies in Mumbai. He spends time across Mumbai, India and Toronto, Canada.

title: Amber E Kellogg
content: VP - Affiliate Origination & Management. Through her unique perspectives acquired via distinguished tenure with a luxury fashion brand and a globally leading bulge bracket bank, Amber combines creative problem solving with well-designed solution mapping to enhance the business and lives of entrepreneurs. Over her three decades of professional career, Amber has collaborated with fashion designers and financial planners. She has cultivated and perfected a unique mindset which secures upsides for businesses in transformational ways. As and AVP of client relations at Occams Advisory, Amber originates new client relationships and cultivates the existing ones to problem solve in her own distinguished and distinguishing style. Amber‚Äôs client centric thinking and problem-solving orientation are distinctly matched with Occams philosophy. Amber lives and works from Phoenix, AZ which she calls her home after her decades in Missouri, Wyoming and Colorado, wherein she still nurtures a unique social and business fan-following.

title: Anupam Satyasheel
content: Founder and Group CEO. Anupam founded Occams Advisory in 2011 and has served as the CEO since 2012. Anupam has advised many CEOs and boards. Under his leadership, Occams has achieved exceptional results for its clients across industries and geographies. Prior to founding Occams, Anupam spent over half a decade on Wall Street with names like Barclays, Merrill Lynch, Scotia Capital et al. Anupam lives and works from Long Beach, CA with his physician wife and two boys. He spends his evenings balancing professional after-hours with baseball and golf with his boys, culinary experiments with his family and deep dive into books on growth, success, and astrophysics. Anupam also serves on the boards of Child Literacy and The Blossom Project, charities dedicated to providing educational opportunities to children in need.

title: Aashish Makkar
content: MD Occams Capital Markets. Aashish brings over 20 years of executive experience to Occams Capital Partners‚Äô leadership team. As Head of Investment Banking, he oversees client service and transaction execution across the firm and leads firm‚Äôs Debt Capital Advisory practice. Aashish joined Occams Capital Partners from EA Markets, where he was responsible for developing new client relationships and overseeing strategic finance advisory and capital markets transaction execution. Previously, he held leveraged finance and capital markets advisory roles at Ondra Partners, UBS and Credit Suisse. He holds an MBA from The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University and a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mechanical Engineering from Maharishi Dayanand University in India. Aashish lives in Princeton, NJ with his wife and two children.

title: Nitin Aggarwal
content:
CEO ‚Äì India
Nitin Aggarwal is the Chief Operating Officer of Occams Advisory in India and he runs the large team of professionals who deliver exceptional services to Occams US based clients. In this role, Nitin has created immense value for the clients.
Previously, Nitin co-founded 247 Experts in 2012 and served as the company‚Äôs CEO between 2012 and 2015. During his tenure, the company grew to become a major player in digital marketing, support services, mobile application clients across all continents. Nitin was responsible for setting 247‚Äôs strategic direction and spearheading its international operations and in digital marketing, mobile applications and IT support. Prior to founding 247 Experts, Nitin worked as a digital marketing consultant, based out of New Delhi & Dehradun, India. He has been a recognized leader in affiliate marketing.
Nitin holds a Bachelor of Technology degree from IIT, Allahabad.

title: David King
content:
Deputy CEO
David exemplifies a leader focused on results and growth, blending strategic acumen with a track record of execution. Currently serving as the Deputy CEO at Occams Advisory, his extensive experience in global banking across Europe laid the foundation for his entrepreneurial journey in the United States. David's lateral thinking adds valuable perspectives to our strategic vision, contributing significantly to our client's growth trajectory.
Residing and operating from Sarasota, Florida, David embraces a multifaceted life. Beyond his professional endeavors, he cherishes his roles as a father to two boys, a devoted husband, a caring son, and an esteemed community leader. David is an avid sports fan and enjoys nothing more than watching his sons from the side of the field. His favorite downtime is spending time in the tranquil stunning waters of the Gulf of Mexico in Florida.

title: Christopher Torres
content:
Executive Advisor ‚Äì Business Origination
Chris Torres has built his career through his market leading insights into client psychology and risk preferences. As a seasoned insurance professional, he is a veteran of financial services and an expert on the drivers of critical insurable risks that impact small and medium businesses. His ability to persuade and influence business leaders to decisions that are challenging in the short term but beneficial in the long term makes him a distinguished leader in this space.
At Occams, Chris leads a broad range of affiliates who seek and secure market expansion and business origination opportunities for Occams‚Äô tax credit team. In his rather short tenure of just over two years, Chris has forged various crucial partnerships that have brought hundreds of clients and dozens of large ticket opportunities to Occams.
Chris lives and works in Phoenix, AZ with his family and has a national mandate for expanding Occams‚Äô client serving business solutions.
